intro: Stemodia diplohyptoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stemodia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
